Evening Snack: Saggubiyyam Bonda Servings : 20 fried tapioca ballsÂ  Most of the people like to have a cup of tea with snacks and it should be fried. Kids and grown ups love to have tasty and crispy snacks everyday or weekly once at home/ outside. If it is raining â˜”ï¸Â then it's time to make fried snacks. Today, I'm sharing fried tapioca balls which is authentic and a recipe from my Mother and it's my favorite snack. We call it 'Saggubiyyam Bonda' which is super crispy outside and soft inside. It mainly contains tapioca ,curd, mixed with salt, chilly, rice flour and some cumin seeds. More about this, It is different from other Bonda( fried snack) I say it is "unique" because in this recipe no need to add water while making dough. Yes, you read correct for more details check below Procedure.Â I hope you like it and give it a try at home ğŸ¡ Duration: 30 mins preparation time + 6 hrs soaking timeÂ  Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Tapioca/ Saggubiyyam - 80 gms
  • Whisked fresh curd / Greek yogurt - 240 ml
  • Rice flour - 160 gms
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Onion - 1 small sized - finely chopped
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Green chillies - finely chopped - 4
  • Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup - finely chopped
  • Oil - To deep fry
Procedure: Pre-Preparation:
  • In a bowl Add whisked curd and tapioca pearls
  • Mix well and cover with lid. Soak atleast 6 hours
  • Let saggubiyyam absorb curd
Process of making Saggubiyyam Bonda:
  • Tapioca/ Saggubiyyam soaked well
  • In the same bowl,Â add salt, chopped chillies, onion, cilantro and cumin seeds
  • Mix well and add rice flour
  • Combine well by hand and Heat oil to deep fry on medium heat
  • When oil is hot, make round dumplings out of prepared dough
  • Drop slowly in oil ( Do this step if you have practice otherwise take help from others)
  • Add 6 to 8 balls in one batch, fry till they turns golden brown
  • Take out them on paper towel
  • Serve hot with tomato sauce/ Mint Sauce/Â Ginger Chutney/Â Coconut ğŸŒ´ chutney/Â Red chilly chutney

Step by step process shown below with pictures:Â  Note:
  • Instead of chopped green chillies you can add green chillies paste
  • Do not add water in dough because it doesn't require water. To this snack only curd moisture is enough to make dough
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Double the ingredients to increase the quantity of Bonda's ( Fried tapioca Balls)
